text: Suggest the parameters considered while selecting Front or rear projected display devices.

subject: Engineering Mechanics
text: A steel tube is rigidly fastened between aluminum and bronze rods and the axial loads are applied at the position shown. Find P that will not exceed stress of 80 MPa in Aluminum, 100 MPa in bronze and 150 MPa in steel, given the following details. Aluminum: A=200mm², L=1m; Steel: A=400 mm², L=2m; Bronze: A=500 mm², L=3 m. Calculate the total deformation for the above condition. Take E_Al = 70 GPa, and E_S = 200 GPa. (Figure provided in the source image)

subject: Engineering Mechanics
text: A metal plate is to be punched with a hole, the plate can take a maximum shear stress of 150 MPa. The compressive stress in the punch is limited to 200 MPa. Determine: i) Maximum thickness of the plate for which a 50 mm diameter hole can be punched ii) If the plate is 5 mm thick, smallest diameter hole that can be punched.

subject: Engineering Mechanics
text: When a tensile axial load was applied on a round bar of 40mm diameter and 2.5m length, the extension observed was 2.5 mm. Calculate the bulk modulus and lateral contraction of the bar if E = 170 GPa & G = 63 GPa.

subject: Engineering Mechanics
text: A composite bar of a rectangular section consists of a tapered aluminum section rigidly fastened between a bronze section and a steel section, as shown in the figure. The thickness of the section is 10mm throughout the length. Axial loads are applied at the positions indicated. Determine the stress in the steel and bronze sections. Also, determine the change in total length. Take E_b = 100 GPa, E_Al = 70 GPa and E_s = 200 GPa. (Figure provided in the source image)

subject: Engineering Mechanics
text: A circular rod of 25mm diameter and 500mm long is subjected to a tensile force of 60kN. Determine the modulus of rigidity, bulk modulus and change in volume if Poisson's ratio is 0.3 and Young's modulus E = 2x10^5 N/mm².

text: Describe the technical specifications of strain gauges.

text: Discuss the merits and demerits of load cells and temperature sensors.

text: Forces 2, sqrt(3), 5, sqrt(3) and 2 kN respectively act at one of the angular points of a regular hexagon towards five other angular points as shown such that θ1 = θ2 = θ3 = θ4 = 30°. Determine the magnitude and direction of the resultant force. (Figure provided in source image)

subject: Engineering Mechanics and Smart Buildings
text: The bar shown in Figure is tested in universal testing machine. It is observed that at a load of 40 kN the total extension of the bar is 0.280 mm. Determine the Young's modulus of the material. (Figure provided in source image)

subject: Engineering Mechanics and Smart Buildings
text: A composite flat consists of Steel, Aluminum and Bronze sections rigidly fastened, as shown. Evaluate the value of axial force P required to keep the flat in equilibrium. Also, find the total extension in the flat considering a uniform thickness of 10 mm. Take Es= 200 GPa, Eal=70 GPa and Eb= 100 GPa. (Figure provided in source image)

subject: Engineering Mechanics and Smart Buildings
text: A plate is having an Ultimate shear stress of 400 MPa. A square cut is to be punched on the plate. If the compressive stress in the cut out is limited to 500 MPa. Determine i) Maximum thickness of the plate for which a square of side 150 mm can be punched ii) If the plate is 75 mm thick, find the dimension of the square cut.

subject: Engineering Mechanics and Smart Buildings
text: A circular specimen of diameter 20 mm is subjected to a tensile force of 19 kN, the diameter of a specimen is found to reduce by 0.004 mm under the load. The modulus of rigidity of the material is 45 GPa. Determine the values of E and μ.
